question: What is the tuition fee for diploma or degree programmes?
answer: Tuition fees vary depending on the programme. For detailed fee structures, please refer to the official TAR UMT Malaysian Student Fees Guide for Year 2025 Intakes: https://www.tarc.edu.my/bursary/content.jsp?cat_id=5AA0377F-4E7F-494A-8EB4-CEF5CE4DD7AE

question: Are there scholarships or financial aid options available?
answer: Yes, TAR UMT offers various financial aid and scholarships. For more information, visit: https://www.tarc.edu.my/dsa/financial-aid/financial-aid/

question: How can I apply for scholarships?
answer: Scholarship applications are processed during admission. Submit required documents including academic transcripts, financial statements, and recommendation letters. For more details, visit: https://www.tarc.edu.my/admissions/a/merit-scholarship/

question: What additional fees should I expect?
answer: Additional fees may include: Registration fee: RM 300-500; Laboratory/practical fees: RM 200-800 per semester; Student services fee: RM 100-200 per semester; Graduation fee: RM 200-400. For a comprehensive list of fees, refer to the Malaysian Student Fees Guide: https://www.tarc.edu.my/bursary/content.jsp?cat_id=5AA0377F-4E7F-494A-8EB4-CEF5CE4DD7AE

question: Can I pay fees in installments?
answer: Yes, fees can be paid in installments per semester. Payment plans are available through the finance office. For more information, visit: https://www.tarc.edu.my/bursary/content.jsp?cat_id=5AA0377F-4E7F-494A-8EB4-CEF5CE4DD7AE

question: Are fees different for international students?
answer: Yes, international students typically pay 10-20% higher fees than local students. For detailed fee structures, please refer to the official TAR UMT Malaysian Student Fees Guide for Year 2025 Intakes: https://www.tarc.edu.my/bursary/content.jsp?cat_id=5AA0377F-4E7F-494A-8EB4-CEF5CE4DD7AE
